page.title: 02LAND AND RIVER AT APPLETON W
page.content: Appleton Wiske and Hornby are small villages set in almost flat.gently rolling countryside.The highest point is Cheescake hill being about 66m high.The area is lightly wooded the fields hedged or well fenced. There is rough grazeing for cattle and sheep.Crops grown are grass,wheat, oats,barley,potatoes,turnips and mangolds for cattle.The River Wiske is to the south of Appleton Wiske and flows from east to west. It has recently been dredged to prevent flooding of adjacent fields. It is crossed by a roadbridge,and a footbridge which are about 250m apart. The river is only small being about 3.5m wide and 30m deep at the road bridge.The flow was calculated to be about 2 cubic metres a minute. Sticklebacks are plentifull in the river but only the 3 spined variety
